newsitem.title: USA: Compilation of major Fed policy surveys -- Nov 12.
newsitem.headline: Compilation of major Fed policy surveys -- Nov 12.

text.p: Following is a compilation of major surveys conducted on the outlook for Federal Reserve monetary policy.
The policy-setting Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) next meets on Wednesday, November 13.

The FOMC is widely expected to leave policy unchanged as inflation remains tame and the economy continues to grow at a moderate pace. But experts said the key question will be whether the central bank lifts its bias toward tighter credit that is presumed to be in place. Most economists expect the Fed to retain the bias for at least another month.
REUTERS 37 Wall St *37 say no move
TECHNICAL 30 Wall St *100 pct say next move in 97
MCM 20 Wall St * All 20 say no move
RIED, 70 Institutional *100 pct no move in Nov,
THUNBERG Investors, Nov 8 3 pct see rate hike in Dec.
-- 53 pct see next move as a
BLUE CHIP 41 Economists/ *63 pct, next move tighten
Late Oct *37 pct, next move ease
